contents.item: Becoming number one is easier than remaining number one.
If you aren't fired with enthusiasm  you'll be fired with enthusiasm.
Sport is one area where no participant is worried about another's race  religion or wealth: and where the only concern is 'Have you come to play?'
Behind every tennis player there is another tennis player.
Catching a fly ball is a pleasure  but knowing what to do with it is a business.
Trying to get a fast ball past Hank Aaron is like trying to get the sun past a rooster.
Golf is a good walk spoiled.
A sportsman is a man who  every now and then  simply has to get out and kill something. Not that he's cruel. He wouldn't hurt a fly. It's not big enough.
Walking is the best possible exercise. Habituate yourself to walk very far.

Hockey captures the essence of the Canadian experience in the New World. In a land so inescapably and inhospitably cold  hockey is the dance of life  and an affirmation that despite the deathly chill of winter we are alive.
The game isn't over until it's over.
The race is not always to the swift nor the battle to the strong - but that's the way to bet.
Sport begets tumultuous strife and wrath  and wrath begets fierce quarrels and war to the death.
Citius  altius  fortius. (Swifter  higher  stronger.)
Well  God is certainly getting an earful tonight.
Going to bed with a woman never hurt a ball player. It's staying up all night looking for them that does you in.

Ninety per cent of this game is half-mental.
I have never been able to understand why pigeon-shooting at Hurlingham should be refined and polite  while a rat-killing match in Whitechapel is low.
When I play with my cat  who knows whether I do not make her more sport  than she makes me?
